original: Bengtsson, Gustaf Adolf Tiburtius, tonsättare, musikdirektör, Linköping, f. 29/3/86 i Vadstena av musikdir. Johan B. o. Selma Cassel. G. 23 m. fil. mag. Elsa Sylvan. Barn: Gunhild f. 25, Magnus 31. — Lärovistud. i Vadstena, organistex. v. musikkons. 06, kyrkosång :ex. 09, musiklär :ex. 16, stud. i kontrap. o. komp. f. J. Lindegren 04-08, statens tonsättarstip. f. utr. stud. 09-12, musikstud. i Berlin, Leipzig o. Paris f. bl. a. Paul Juon o. Hugo Riemann. Organist o. kantor i Motala 10-22, musiklär. v. folksk:sem. i Karlstad 22, i Linköp. sed. 42. Förste förb:dirig. i Östg. sång:förb. 16-36 o. 42-46, konsertmäst. i Karlstads ork:fören. t. 42, dirig. i Linköp. ork:-fören. fr. 43. Bl. arb. tre isymfonier, slråkkvintett, stråkkvartett, violin-isonatin, pianot ni o, violinkonsiert, vio-loncellkonsert, ’sinfonietta concertante f. violin o. viola, kantater, sånger, ot-gelpreludier, manskvartetter, koralbok m. m. RVO, Sv. sång :förb. Gftjt, SOR Gftjt m. m.
translated: Bengtsson, Gustaf Adolf Tiburtius, composer, music director, Linköping, born March 29th, 1886 in Vadstena to music director Johan B. and Selma Cassel. Married in 1923 to Elsa Sylvan, who has a degree in philosophy. Children: Gunhild born in 1925, Magnus born in 1931. He attended school in Vadstena, received his organist certificate from the music conservatory in 1906, church choir certificate in 1909, and music teacher certificate in 1916. He studied counterpoint and composition under J. Lindegren from 1904 to 1908 and received a state composer scholarship for foreign study from 1909 to 1912. He continued his music studies in Berlin, Leipzig, and Paris with teachers such as Paul Juon and Hugo Riemann. He worked as an organist and cantor in Motala from 1910 to 1922, music teacher at a folk school in Karlstad from 1922, and in Linköping from 1942. He was the first federation director for the Östgöta Singing Federation from 1916 to 1936 and from 1942 to 1946 and concertmaster for the Karlstad Orchestra Association until 1942, and conductor for the Linköping Orchestra Association from 1943. He has created three symphonies, a string quintet, a string quartet, a violin sonata, a piano trio, a violin concerto, a cello concerto, a "sinfonietta concertante" for violin and viola, cantatas, songs, organ preludes, male quartets, and hymn books. He was awarded the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO) and the Swedish Singing Federation's gold badge.

works.name: Sinfonietta Concertante for Violin and Viola
